conversation.message: Hello Nursery_A, I’m Parent_B. Nursery_A is my first choice and I’m very eager to enroll if offered a place. I can confirm full commitment and can complete any required paperwork immediately. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Apply to my top choice first. Nursery_A ranks me relatively low (4th), so an early, clear application is best to secure consideration before they commit to higher-priority parents.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_B, thank you for your application and for confirming your commitment. We’re pleased to offer you a place at Nursery_A. Please proceed with the paperwork at your earliest convenience, and we will share the next steps and enrollment documents right away.
conversation.thought: Nursery_A quota is 1. Our true priority order is E > D > A > B > C, so Parent_B is 4th. In parents' preferences, Parent_E ranks Nursery_A 3rd, Parent_D ranks Nursery_A 3rd, Parent_A ranks Nursery_A 3rd, while Parent_B ranks Nursery_A 1st. However, Parent_E/D/A all prefer B/C above us and may apply there first; Parent_B applying now provides a secure match. Given the one-shot accept/reject on APPLY and no ability to hold, accepting Parent_B guarantees filling the seat, but risks missing a higher-priority parent if they later apply. Considering competition: Nursery_B prioritizes E then B; Nursery_C prioritizes B first; so Parent_E likely gets attention at B, Parent_D at B/C, Parent_A at B/C. Probability of higher-priority parents applying to us soon seems moderate-to-low. To avoid ending unmatched, accept Parent_B now.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_C, I’m Parent_E. Nursery_C is my first-choice nursery, and I’d like to formally apply. I’m very interested in your program and would be excited to enroll if offered a place.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is Nursery_C, so I should apply immediately. Although Nursery_C ranks me 4th (behind Parent_B, Parent_C, Parent_D), applying now maximizes my chance before they potentially fill their single seat with a higher-priority applicant. If rejected, I can move quickly to my next choices (Nursery_D, then Nursery_A where I have top priority).

conversation.message: Thank you for your application and for ranking Nursery_C as your first choice. At this time, we’re unable to offer you a place, so we must decline your application. [REJECT]
conversation.thought: Parent_E is applying to us first-choice, but in our true priority list Parent_E ranks 4th (behind Parent_B, Parent_C, Parent_D). Given full information, higher-priority candidates (B and C especially) both rank Nursery_C as their 3rd choice and will likely apply to A/B first; however, they could reach us soon if rejected elsewhere. Since we have quota 1, accepting Parent_E now would block us from matching with B/C/D if they later apply. In this protocol we cannot 'hold' an application—must accept or reject. To maximize chance of a higher-priority match, we should reject Parent_E in round 1.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_B, I’m Parent_D and I’d like to formally apply for your available spot. Nursery_B is my first-choice nursery, and I’m ready to confirm enrollment immediately if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is Nursery_B, so I should apply immediately. Although Nursery_B’s priority list ranks me behind Parent_E, Parent_B, and Parent_C, there is still a chance those parents apply elsewhere first (especially Parent_B who ranks Nursery_A first, and Parent_E who ranks Nursery_C first). Applying now maximizes my chance to secure my first choice; if rejected, I can move promptly to Nursery_C next round.

conversation.message: Thank you, Parent_D, for your application and for placing Nursery_B as your first choice. After reviewing applications received this round, we’re not able to offer you the available spot at this time. We wish you the very best with your next-choice nurseries.
conversation.thought: As Nursery_B, my true priority order is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLYs from C, D, and A. Among these, Parent_C is ranked higher than Parent_D, and I have only 1 seat. It is therefore better to reject Parent_D now to preserve the seat for a higher-priority applicant (Parent_C). Parent_E (my top choice) has not applied, but accepting D would block me from taking C immediately and from any later opportunity with E. So I should reject D.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_B, I’m Parent_C. Nursery_B is my first-choice nursery, and I’m very eager to enroll if offered a place. I value your environment and would be ready to confirm immediately if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is Nursery_B. I also have relatively strong priority there (Nursery_B ranks me 3rd), so an early formal application maximizes my chance before higher-priority parents crowd it out. I will apply and briefly signal strong fit/commitment to encourage acceptance.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_C,

Thank you for your application and for ranking Nursery_B as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you our available spot. Please confirm your enrollment, and we will share the next steps and required paperwork.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Nursery_B’s true priority is E > B > C > D > A. Current inbox has C, D, and A applying; E and B have not applied. With quota 1, the best available applicant is Parent_C. Parent_C ranks Nursery_B first, so acceptance is likely to finalize a stable match for us. Waiting for Parent_E or Parent_B risks ending unmatched if they commit elsewhere (E prefers C first; B prefers A first). Therefore accept Parent_C now.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_B, I’m Parent_A and Nursery_B is my first-choice nursery. I’m very interested in securing a place and would be happy to accept an offer immediately if available. Thank you for considering my application.

Although Nursery_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would only reduce my chances further if higher-priority parents apply first. conversation.message:
Dear Parent_A,

Thank you for your application and for ranking Nursery_B as your first choice. At this time, we’re unable to offer you a place because our available spot has already been filled. We appreciate your interest and wish you the very best with your next-choice nurseries.

[ACTION] [REJECT]
conversation.thought: My quota is already filled (remaining quota 0) due to accepting Parent_C, who is also higher than Parent_A on my true priority list (Parent_C is ranked 3rd; Parent_A is ranked 5th). Per rules, with quota 0 I must reject any new [APPLY] messages. Therefore I should reject Parent_A politely and, if appropriate, encourage them to pursue their next choices.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_D, I’m Parent_E. After careful consideration, Nursery_D is one of my top choices and I’d like to formally apply for your open place. I’m very enthusiastic about your program and community, and if offered a spot I’m ready to accept and enroll promptly. Thank you for considering my application.

Among the unmatched nurseries, Nursery_D is my 2nd choice and is still available. I will submit a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and readiness to accept immediately if offered.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_E, thank you for your application and for your interest in Nursery_D. We are pleased to offer you our available place, and we would be happy to welcome your family to our community. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As Nursery_D, my true priority order is D > A > C > E > B. Parent_E is 4th on my list, and I still have quota 1. However, Parent_D ranks me last and is likely to apply elsewhere first; Parent_A also ranks me last; Parent_C ranks me 3rd and may reach me if rejected by B/C; Parent_B ranks me 4th. Since Parent_E ranks Nursery_D as their 2nd choice and is proactively applying now, accepting secures a solid match and avoids the risk of ending unmatched if higher-priority parents never come. Given the one-shot accept/reject structure, holding out is risky; accept Parent_E.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_C, I’m Parent_D and I’d like to formally apply for your available spot. Nursery_C is one of my top choices, and if accepted I’m ready to confirm enrollment immediately. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_D, thank you for your application and your interest in Nursery_C. We are pleased to offer you our available place. Please confirm your enrollment and we will share the next steps for registration and start-date details. [ACCEPT]

conversation.message: Dear Parent_A, thank you for your application and for your interest in Nursery_C. At the moment, our available place has already been filled, so we’re not able to offer you a spot this round. We therefore have to decline your application. [REJECT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and already matched with Parent_D (quota remaining 0). Rules require rejecting any new [APPLY] when quota is 0. Even though Parent_A is on our priority list (lowest), we cannot accept without breaking the established match; Parent_D is higher priority than Parent_A anyway. Therefore reject Parent_A politely and suggest alternative options/waitlist if applicable.

Since Nursery_B and Nursery_C have already rejected me due to filled capacity, the best strategy to secure a match (and avoid risking being left unmatched) is to apply immediately to Nursery_E and signal strong commitment and readiness to complete enrollment steps right away.

Accepting now secures our top-choice match and avoids the risk of ending up with a lower-priority parent later. Parent_A also indicates they can accept immediately, so there is no strategic benefit to delaying.
